author: Emma Munbodh
title: Virgin Trains cheap tickets: This hack could get you a London to Birmingham RETURN for £15
text:
Virgin Trains is famous for its super-fast service - with London to Manchester in less than 2 hours 9 minutes.
The operator specialises in long-distance passenger services on the West Coast Main Line from its London Euston terminus and connects six of the UK's largest cities; London, Birmingham, Manchester, Liverpool, Glasgow and Edinburgh - with London to Birmingham in less than 1 hour 24 minutes.
But, as many commuters will know, Virgin Trains' premium service comes with a price tag to match - at £164.50 for a peak time London to Manchester single journey alone.
Here are 11 more ways to save on train fares in the UK . For even more tips, bookmark our train ticket sales page .
Get 70% off your fare with 'Ticket Offers' As with all train operators, travellers are advised to book in advance (up to four-weeks) to get the best fares and prices.
We've found one trick that could save you pounds on your tickets, even if you book 1-hour before travel.
The Virgin Trains homepage directs users to their journey planner, however in the top right hand corner you'll see a ' Ticket Offers ' tab - hit it for their best fare finder tool.
Best fare finder lists the cheapest fares on your date of travel - and divides times by morning, afternoon and evening.
How much can I save? A standard off peak Manchester to London return costs £80.60 per person each-way when you book on-the-day.
However, book 24-hours before travel and you can get a ticket for £20 each way during the school summer period, or £11 throughout the year. That's an automatic saving of at least £60.
25% off advance train fares to Festival No. 6 Virgin Trains is offering 25% off all advance fares to Festival No.6 2015 in Portmeirion, North Wales from 3 - 6 September 2015 - closest station Bangor.
They're the official sponsors, so they have a number of discounted tickets going. Discount can be used up to a maximum of 9 passengers - tickets are on sale now .
Book in advance for the best savings Even booking an hour in advance can give you that ‘bagged a bargain’ feeling. Advance bookings also guarantee you a seat.
Advance tickets (Standard and First Class) are released up to three months before travel.
You can book up to 1-hour in advance, however, the earlier the better as many of the 'leftover' tickets are late night or very early morning.
The best time to book: Weekdays tend to be quietest between 10:30 and 14:30 or after 20:00.
Save 1/3 with your railcard discount If you own a railcard , apply the discount to save even more on your Virgin Trains journey.
A railcard can grant you a third off your travel - and is valid for anyone aged between 16-25, over 60, disabled or with a family (discounts only if you travel with at least one child).
For more tips and tricks on how to save on train fares, see our cheap rail tickets guide .
